main.name: Leon Lei
main.bio: I am presently studying Computer Science at Brown University and expect to graduate May 2020. I am currently on a 4 year Concurrent Masters and Sc.B. Program in CS. My main interests lie in software development, data science, and computer graphics. I like to challenge myself by taking on a rigorous load of coursework each semester in addition to the various activities and extracurriculars that I participate in.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to reach out to me!

resume.skillmessage: I am a capable and responsive worker who is deeply invested in producing high quality results. My skillset is diverse but focused, and I can pick up new skills quickly and effectively.

education.degree: Concurrent Masters and Sc.B. in Computer Science
education.description: Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Interactive Computer Graphics, Data Science, Collaborative Robotics, Software Engineering, Creating Modern Web Apps, Design/Impl. of Programming Languages, Design/Analysis of Algorithms, Discrete Structures/Probability, Statistics, Linear Algebra, Computer Systems, Game Theory and Economics

work.title: Head Teaching Assistant
work.description: For CS1410 - Artificial Intelligence. Worked closely with the professor and lead 18 TAs in updating and running the course. Played a significant role in handling course logistics and helped students at office hours and on Piazza with conceptual questions and debugging.

work.title: SDE Intern
work.description: Drove the development of a new debugging tool to support quick access to API data from shipping and tracking services, making it easier and at least 3x faster for engineers to get the data they need. Implemented, reviewed, and shipped code in Java and JavaScript, followed scrum agile methodology. Delivered results in a timely fashion and helped with a separate project (Video on Delivery) afterwards.

work.title: Data Science Intern
work.description: Developed a visualization tool with R Shiny and D3.js for Roche analysts looking at patient journeys. Processed large amounts of real-world patient data, producing optimizations in R with ~40x speedup. Generated visualization trees to assist researchers with an XGBoost machine learning use case. Presented work via teleconference to Roche’s global leaders in real-world data and visual analytics.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Studied effects of language on children’s social ties using data from positional and auditory sources. Created data processing tools and visualizations with C# and MATLAB. Authorship on presentations given at conferences/meetings in Philadelphia, Norwich, Amsterdam, etc.

projects.title: Galar Pokemon App
projects.category: Introducing all 400 pokemon in the new Galar Region.

projects.title: ABOT Database Website
projects.category: How human-like does your robot look?

projects.title: Iterative Design
